title: Erdős Problem #624

overview.problemStatement: Let X" role="presentation" style="position: relative;">XXX be a finite set of size n" role="presentation" style="position: relative;">nnn and H(n)" role="presentation" style="position: relative;">H(n)H(n)H(n) be such that there is a function f:{A:A⊆X}→X" role="presentation" style="position: relative;">f:{A:A⊆X}→Xf:{A:A⊆X}→Xf:\{A : A\subseteq X\}\to X so that for every Y⊆X" role="presentation" style="position: relative;">Y⊆XY⊆XY\subseteq X with |Y|≥H(n)" role="presentation" style="position: relative;">|Y|≥H(n)|Y|≥H(n)\lvert Y\rvert \geq H(n) we have{f(A):A⊆Y}=X." role="presentation" style="text-align: center; position: relative;">{f(A):A⊆Y}=X.{f(A):A⊆Y}=X.
